text: I'm having an issues with putting in CTA's in a custom modules. Getting this error.
This is what I have
The syntax looks correct <@UATE4ATHP> - are you working in the new design manager
<@UE24LMGSZ> yeah
Was that module created in the new design manager, or the old one?
The banner indicates that it's an old module
neither? haha. It was added to the portal via the API

You mean FTP? I'm not as well-versed in FTP, but (grasping at straws here) I wonder if there's an incorrect property in the JSON body of the module that was uploaded, causing the DM to see it as an old module :shrug:
Are you able to use the same code to reproduce the error in a module that you created from within the DM?

We have an app that adds modules to a portal with the custom-widgets API `<https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v4/custom-widgets>` I'm not sure 100% how it works, so It could be via FTP.  But yeah, If I copy the code to a new module or clone it. It works
If you wanna link me to the module with the error, I could take a closer look at the JSON and see if I find anything.
FTP is a facade over the APIs like custom-widgets. You probably need to change the “version” property to 2
I accept your facade as reality
lol
So we should be using `<https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/custom-widgets>`?
FTP is an illusion, the API is a hologram!
The Matrix is real :matrix:
You can use whatever’s easiest for you. FTP is just there to make the APIs “look like” a file system
<@U22PJPGK0> were you referring to the `schemaVersion` property? Theirs is currently set to `1`
yes. that’s the one
assuming it doesn’t have nested modules
[[oh,yeah],[it,is]]
<@UE24LMGSZ> What should the `schemaVersion` be? and does would we change it?

The JSON body of the custom module (the file being submitted via API) should have the `schemaVersion` property set to `2` instead of `1`.
If the modules are being pushed to a portal from your dev's local environment, then the developer who created the module would need to update the JSON, and re-POST it to your portal.

if HubSpot is the Matrix, does that make Dharmesh the Architect?

I think MColey is the Oracle.
<@UE24LMGSZ> I'm looking for `schemaVersion` but I don't see it. Would it be in `meta.json` for the module?
Hmm I guess so! I didn't see that field. But I just added it and re-pushed the module and it worked. Thanks <@UE24LMGSZ>
Nice! Glad we got through that one. Shoutout to <@U22PJPGK0> for the help!
not to turn this into Random, but I think :sbristow:  would be Morpheus “let me show you how deep the rabbit hole goes”
Can :will: be Neo?
hahah YEAAS!
Still one of my all time favorite movies to watch.
